All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Arrow
This is a child class of Projectile.
AudioPlayer
Audio Player is a class that allows WAV files to be played through the use of Java CLIPS.
Constants
Handles every constant variable that will be used for this game for all classes.
Constants.BackgroundStates
Background Parallax Assets (i.e.
Constants.ButtonStates
Menu Button / Pause Button Vars and Constants
Constants.Directions
Direction Variables
Constants.EndButtons
End Screen buttons (Both for level completed and Death screen)
Constants.EnemyConstants
Enemy Animation States and Constants
Constants.OverworldButtonConstants
All Constants for the Overworld
Constants.PlayerStates
Player Animation States and Constants
Constants.ProjectileConstants
Projectile Animation States and Constants
DeathOverlay
This class handles the Death overlay when the Player entity health reaches 0 during gameplay
DemoButton
This class is responsible for handling the creation of, and interaction with, buttons bound within the DemoOverlay
DemoOverlay
This class handles the DemoOverlay when the use reaches the end of the demo levels
DriverInterface
This is a very basic interface that all unit tests/drivers should follow.
EndButtons
This class is responsible for handling the creation of, and interaction with, buttons bound within the Pause Overlay
Enemy
This is an abstract class that provides the framework for all Enemy objects in the game.
EnemyManager
EnemyManager will handle all enemies in each level.
Entity
This abstract Entity class shares functionality across all player and enemy objects.
EntityDriver
This will test all classes in the Entity package
Game
This class handle most logic pertaining to the game, including updates, FPS, level scale, and tile amount on screen.
GamePanel
This class acts as the painting in the frame
GameStates
This enum holds every state that the game can be in.
GameWindow
This class will act as the frame holding the painting
HelperMethods
This class is full of various methods that will be called by more than just one entity, object, or class
HUD
The HUD or Heads Up Display will always be visible during gameplay to inform the player of their score, their current health, and the enemies remaining
InputsDriver
This class tests all of the classes in the inputs package (Mouse and Keyboard inputs).
Instructions
Instructions State class gives functionality to the Instructions button on the Main Menu
InstructionsButton
This class represents 1 Button on the Instructions GameState.
KeyboardInputs
This class will convert the key events from the user to actions on the screen, by passing in each event to the proper game state.
Level
Every object instantiated from this class will be a level that the user can play throughout.
LevelManager
This class will handle things such as importing level sprites, drawing the level to the screen, and keep track of the current level played
LevelsDriver
This is a tester for all of the classes inside of the levels package.
LoadSave
This class is focused on loading in sprite data, level data, and building levels.
MainClass
This main class acts as a singular point to branch off from, when starting the game
Menu
This is a child class of State that implements the StateMethods interface.
MenuButton
This class represents 1 Button on the Menu GameState.
MouseInputs
This class will convert the mouse events from the user to actions on the screen, by passing in each event to the proper game state.
Overworld
This is a child class of State that implements the StateMethods interface.
OverworldButton
This class represents how a "level"/button is displayed on the Overworld GameState.
PauseButton
This class is responsible for handling the creation of, and interaction with, buttons bound within the Pause Overlay
PauseOverlay
This class handles the pause overlay when the user hits the pause button during gameplay
Player
This player class will hold every variable and funciton relating to the active player's inputs and outputs.
Playing
This is a child class of State that implements the StateMethods interface.
Projectile
This class will provide the framework for how all Projectiles in game and the basis for how they should move.
ProjectileManager
This class will be a manager/factory for the Playing GameState.
ProjectilesDriver
This will test all class in the projectile package
Skeleton
Skeleton is a child-class of Enemy.
SkeletonKing
Skeleton King is a child-class of Enemy.
SoundButton
This class is responsible for handling the creation of, and interactions with, the Sound button bound within the Pause Overlay
State
This state class defines how each state should behave when instantiated from this parent class
StateMethods
Defines every method that a state should have when instantiated new
StatesDriver
This will test all of the classes in the states package
UIDriver
This will test all of the classes in the UI package
UnitTester
This is the main driver.
UtilsDriver
This will test all of the classes in the utils package
WinOverlay
This class handles the Death overlay when the Player entity health reaches 0 during gameplay
